A few have asked about our stance on NFTs:

NFTs are a scam. If you think they are legitimately useful for anything other than the exploitation of creators, financial scams, and the destruction of the planet we ask that please reevaluate your life choices.

Peace ✌️

— itch.io (@itchio) February 6, 2022

Like other companies within the industry, the digital game distribution platform itch.io has spoken about NFTs and their uses in video games: “NFTs are a scam”, we read in the first tweet of what is a short thread. “If you really think they are useful for something other than the exploitation of creators, financial scams and the destruction of the planet, we ask you to please re-evaluate the decisions you have made in your life.”

The independent store created by Leaf Corcoran has also positioned itself against all those companies that have been in favor of NFTs while claiming to support the creators: “they only care about their profits and the opportunity to earn more than everyone else.” In the same thread they encourage all people to learn about the problems related to this technology and the empty promises that have arisen around it.

The positioning of itch.io collides with that of other companies such as Ubisoft, which not only has its own token sale platform but last week began giving them away to its employees in a move that has not had the positive reception they expected. Among the companies that have had to retract their approach to NFTs is Team17, which received harsh criticism from the studios it works with, or GSC Game World, which intended to implement NFTs in STALKER 2.
